articles.description: New Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe says his "preference" is to build a new stadium that can also "serve the north of England".
articles.title: Man Utd's Ratcliffe wants 'national stadium in north'

articles.description: Mercedes team principal Toto Wolff has called for 'transparency' in the investigation into Red Bull's Christian Horner.
articles.title: Christian Horner: Red Bull principal's investigation 'an issue for all of Formula 1' - Toto Wolff

articles.description: Teenager Luke Littler says predictions of him surpassing the great Phil Taylor are 'crazy'.
articles.title: Luke Littler downplays comparisons to 16-time world champion Phil Taylor

articles.description: Sir Jim Ratcliffe says Manchester United must "walk to the right solution not run to the wrong one" after completing a deal to purchase a 27.7% stake in the club.
articles.title: Man Utd 'must walk to right solution not run to wrong one'

articles.description: Spanish football writer Guillem Balague tells BBC Sport why Paris St-Germain striker Kylian Mbappe has agreed to join Real Madrid this summer.
articles.title: Why Mbappe is swapping Paris St-Germain for Real Madrid

articles.description: There is "every chance" England captain Ben Stokes will bowl in the fourth Test against India in Ranchi, says vice-captain Ollie Pope.
articles.title: Every chance Stokes will bowl in fourth Test - Pope

articles.description: Manager Thomas Tuchel will leave Bayern Munich at the end of the season.
articles.title: Bayern Munich boss Tuchel to leave at end of season

articles.description: Scotland wing Kyle Steyn aims to deliver an eye-catching performance against England after missing the France game when his wife went into labour.
articles.title: New dad Steyn eyes Calcutta Cup after 'screaming' at TV

articles.description: England captain Ben Stokes could bowl in the fourth Test against India after he had a net session with the ball before the match in Ranchi.
articles.title: Stokes bowls in nets before fourth Test

articles.description: Tim David powers Australia to victory over New Zealand on the final ball of a thrilling first T20 in Auckland.
articles.title: Australia beat NZ in last-ball T20 thriller
